subject: Coming up on Reliable Sources
body:
CNN.com










Coming up this Sunday on Reliable Sources:,

Politics and the Media

John McCain
officially announced his candidacy this week, but the media
appears jaded on the man once hailed as a political maverick.
Is it because he backs the war?  And Jon Stewart goes head to
head with McCain, but was it comedy?

DC Madam
Scandal

Deputy Secretary of State Randall Tobias
resigned after confirming to ABC's Brian Ross that he had been
a customer of Jeanne Palfrey's D.C. escort service.  Tobias
says he was just getting massages, but Palfrey is currently
under indictment for running a prostitution ring. Should ABC be
broadcasting Palfrey's list of customers?

War
Stories

When they broke, the Jessica Lynch and Pat
Tillman stories seemed like made-for TV movies, but perhaps
that's all they should have been.  How did the media get these
two reports so wrong?  Is the wartime press falling down on the
job?

Plus, Rosie O'Donnell is leaving the
view.  Was her departure voluntary, or had she crossed the line
with her vocal views?

Join us this Sunday and every
Sunday at 10am ET / 7am PT for our critical look at the media!
,
